AI Feynman¶

This code is an improved implementation of AI Feynman: a Physics-Inspired Method for Symbolic Regression, Silviu-Marian Udrescu and Max Tegmark (2019) [Science Advances] and AI Feynman 2.0: Pareto-optimal symbolic regression exploiting graph modularity, Udrescu S.M. et al. (2020) [arXiv].

Example usage:

from feynman import run_aifeynman

run_aifeynman("../example_data/", "example1.txt", 30,
              "14ops.txt", polyfit_deg=3, NN_epochs=500)

Where ‘example1.txt’ contains tab separated data that the regression is performed over, and ‘14ops.txt’ contains the operations the regression is permitted to use.

Installation (From source)¶

Prereqs: (I made the numbers up)

  • numpy (>= 1.15)

  • torch (>= 1.0)

  • wheel

Build distribution:

python setup.py sdist

Install:

pip install dist/feynman-2.0.0.tar.gz

Test:

python examples/example.py
feynman.S_run_aifeynman.run_AI_all(pathdir, filename, BF_try_time=60, BF_ops_file_type='14ops', polyfit_deg=3, NN_epochs=4000, PA=ParetoSet([], key=<function ParetoSet.__init__.<locals>.<lambda>>))¶

Runs AI Feynman.

Parameters

  • pathdir (str) – path to workspace

  • filename (str) – name of dataset file

Returns

the pareto frontier of solutions

Return type

ParetoSet

feynman
